Andrew Slewter

fun, balanced, curious

What's your favorite movie?

Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade

If you could have dinner with one person, dead or alive, who would it be and why?

Normally, I might pick a historical figure like Augustus Ceasar, but when I saw this question I immediately thought about my grandfather on my dad's side who I never got to meet. I hear he was an adventurous, fun, and playful person. So, I think having dinner with him would be a pretty fun experience.

What's one skill that you could teach everyone else in class?

Given some of my project management background some things that immediately come to mind are pairwise comparison as a means to prioritize feature sets, or project estimation as a means to determine difficulty, duration, etc.

What is the one thing about you that people would be surprised to learn?

Though I don't have any ethnic ties to Eastern Europe, I've lived in Russia and Romania for a total of about 5 years. Both experiences shared a number of similarities and at the same time were dramatically different. I'd be happy to speak with classmates about both.

What is the one thing about you that people would be surprised to learn?

I am the most honest person I know.

If you could have dinner with one person, dead or alive, who would it be and why?

Rose Schneiderman, one of the most influential women in the history of the women's rights movement of the early 20th century. I would love to learn about how she overcame some of the greatest hurdles in the fight for what ultimately became the New Deal - what worked, what didn't, and her assessment of why.

If you could have dinner with one person, dead or alive, who would it be and why?

I would choose Joe Rogan. First off, who wouldn't want to sit down with a comedian and self-made entrepreneur? Second, his podcast 'The Joe Rogan Experience' is one of the most successful podcasts on the internet. This allows him to speak to some pretty interesting people, and picking his brain and conversing with him would be great.

Phil Gutowski

honest, funny, contemplative

What's your favorite movie?

Fanstastic Mr.Fox

If you could have dinner with one person, dead or alive, who would it be and why?

I would much prefer to have dinner with someone who is living. This is due mostly to my appreciation for sharing interesting conversation. Although I have never had the opportunity to dine with the deceased, I would assume it may be less enjoyable than having dinner with someone who is alive. So, if I were to choose to invite a living person to dinner, I think it would have to be Ch√∂gyam Trungpa Rinpoche. Chogyam Ringpoche is someone who introduced elements of Budhism to the West in the 1960's. His teachings are based on a vision, which sees enlightened society as not purely mythical, but as realizable by people of all faiths through practices of mindfulness/awareness, non-aggression, and sacred outlook. To me, these concepts are at the same time, both simple and extremely complex. I'm left with a million questions about life and our place in the world. All questions I would LOVE to ask over dinner!

What's one skill that you could teach everyone else in class?

Well, I suppose I could teach some simple guitar. That's always fun.

What is the one thing about you that people would be surprised to learn?

I spent part of my life working as a crew member aboard a massive superyacht, catering to the ultra rich and... I hated it.

Joseph Campbell. As someone embarking on a journey that will ideally alter my path for the better, I would love to learn and receive guidance from a man that examined who we are at our core and why we seek what we seek. I believe that many (if not all) of us in this program are here because it is the next step in discovering our own path, and I am certainly no different.

Alex Fox

night owl, savvy, morbid

What's your favorite movie?

The Departed / The Big Lebowski

If you could have dinner with one person, dead or alive, who would it be and why?

I'd like to have dinner with Winston Churchill. He was an incredibly smart man and a great leader, and I've read that he was quite the jokester as well. We'd have a good dinner, probably some delicious steaks, medium rare, and we'd dine at Buckingham Palace. Afterwards, we'd smoke a cigar and drink whiskey, while discussing the politics of Nazi Germany and WW2 wartime strategies.

What's one skill that you could teach everyone else in class?

Draw cubes...make egg drop ramen...start a fire with some logs, lighter fluid, and a match...yeah, I'm pretty skilled.

What is the one thing about you that people would be surprised to learn?

I'm terrible at math. Writing is my forte, I have a degree in History. People are surprised to hear this when I say I want to go into the computer programming field.

Flaming tennis. (censored)

What is the one thing about you that people would be surprised to learn?

I got a different friend to fill out each of the previous questions (Some of them were edited for content or clarity, and it seems my friend who answered the 'skills' question enjoys breaking the rules...) I think I learned a little about myself in the process, and hopefully you've learned a little about me too!

Derek Kaknes

mathematical, inquisitive, quiet

What's your favorite movie?

Monty Python and the Holy Grail

If you could have dinner with one person, dead or alive, who would it be and why?

I would have to choose Hernan Cortes. I read a biography of Cortes and was blown away by his story - he led a small group of Spaniards deep into Mexico to topple the Aztec empire and capture their capital city, which was the largest city in the world at the time. The man was certainly flawed and committed some terrible atrocities, but his sheer audacity, determination and fanatical religious devotion were astounding. It's hard to admire a man like that, but I can't think of a person who would provide more interesting dinner conversation than Cortes.

What's one skill that you could teach everyone else in class?

Investment banking! Our modern financial system is so incredibly screwed up that I think it imperative that every person with a bank account understands exactly how their deposits are being whisked across the globe by their banks.

What is the one thing about you that people would be surprised to learn?

I'm an identical twin. My twin brother, Nick, is a medical resident in Miami, FL.

What's your favorite movie?

If you could have dinner with one person, dead or alive, who would it be and why?

Elizabeth Warren: She is both brilliant and compassionate, a rare combination for a person with power. She has the mental ability to understand complex problems, come up with reasonable solutions, and has the clout to get them implemented. Furthermore, she seems very approachable which is important for a shy-ish person like myself.

What's one skill that you could teach everyone else in class?

What is the one thing about you that people would be surprised to learn?

Despite being clumsy and artistically-challenged, I'm quite crafty. My kids and I have made over 50 duct tape wallets and have knit dozens of hats/scarves/slippers. We make origami Christmas tree ornaments and Halloween costumes every year. Just don't ask me to draw.
